events.message: Customer reported a minor car accident involving a collision with a roadside barrier on March 14th at 5 PM.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after verification of the incident details and initial report.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to manage communication and next steps with the customer.
Customer received an acknowledgment of the claim submission along with the expected claims process timeline.
Request sent to customer for additional documents including photos of the vehicle damage and police report.
Customer submitted all requested documentation promptly, including detailed photos and the accident police report.
Investigation began with an assessment of the vehicle damage and review of the submitted documents.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the damage is consistent with the reported collision scenario.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repair costs minus the deductible amount.
Customer provided feedback expressing satisfaction with the timely communication and fair settlement offer.
The claim was formally approved based on the investigation report and customer agreement to the proposed settlement.
Payment for the approved claim was issued to the customerâ€™s account to cover the repair expenses.
The claim was officially closed following confirmation that the customer received payment and vehicle repairs are underway.
The case files and correspondence were archived for record keeping and future reference if needed.
